agent_utterance: On this hot Wednesday afternoon, try a tiny, optional routine at about a 3/5 effort: 1) slowly sip a glass of water (or a light electrolyte drink if you have one), 2) take 60 seconds for a gentle breath or body-scan, 3) rest for 2 minutes in a cool spot or with a fan/AC. You can skip any step and just rest. If you feel up to it later, you might have a small snack you feel comfortable with.

For now, I’d prefer to stay flexible and not commit to a specific eating goal.

agent_utterance: Thank you for setting a clear, gentle direction. Let’s keep today ultra-low-pressure and optional. You can choose one tiny micro-step and nothing else, with support from your therapist or a trusted person if you’d like. Options: 1) Name your current hunger: hungry / not hungry / unsure. 2) If you want a small hydrating check, take one tiny sip of water and pause for 1–2 minutes. 3) If you prefer a snack, hold a familiar item in your hand for 3–5 minutes with no expectation to eat more. If you’d like, I can help you draft a brief note to your therapist or trusted person to join you in this small step. Tell me which option you want to try, or say you’d rather skip for now, and I’ll check back later and we’ll adjust together.
